Fields.DialogueText: Hipper, I need to see you, please.
I'll be there in just a Moment, Kapitän!
You have a way of saying that and then getting lost in work for hours. Let's talk now.
'tschuldigung, Kapitän, I was just inspecting the Maschinen. They...
Yes, I know they've been having some issues. That's what I wanted to see you about.
Jo, of course, Kapitän. I assure you, I've been doing my best to identify the Problem, and...
No, Hipper, it's my turn. I'm not blaming you, but I have to emphasize - what happened with the stall-out earlier cannot happen again.
I've been running every Test I can think of. What else would you suggest I do?

Fields.MenuText: Your issue, your problem, Hipper.
I'm sure we can figure it out together.
I don't know, but I'm confident you'll figure out the solution soon.

Fields.DialogueText: That's hardly considerate, Kapitän.
Is des so? You don't seem very happy with me.
You're confident? That makes one of us.
Look, I apologize if I was a little harsh. It's just that these engine troubles, they're making me, well...
Zittern wie Espenlaub?
That's... one way of saying it.
Just trying to lighten the mood.
*ALARM*
All hands, battle stations, battle stations.
Good luck with that.
@BATTLE
I told you, Kapitän, regarding the Maschinen, I'm open to suggestions.
You're literally the personification of this ship, Hipper. Can't you tell what's wrong with... you?
You think there's something wrong with me?
You know what I mean.
I'm... not sure I do.
I mean the engines. There is something wrong with your engines.
The Maschinen are me, Kapitän. If something is wrong with them, something is wrong with me.
All right, fine. Don't take it personally. Becoming overly concerned with the inherent complications of the matter isn't going to help.
I'm not overly concerned. Wer ist hier besorgt?

Fields.MenuText: Clearly, you are!
Have you looked in a mirror?
No one, clearly.

Fields.DialogueText: I am not!
Why? Is something amiss with my appearance?
Guad, I'm glad you've figured that out.
I'm not going to justify that with a response.
What's there to justify?
*ALARM*
Radio request for assistance, Captain!
I have to get to the bridge. Hipper, we're going to have to continue this conversation at a later time.
@BATTLE
Kapitän!
What?!
Did you just feel that?
Feel... Hipper, are you throttling the screws again?
Just trying to find the source of what's wrong with me, Kapitän.
I'm not sure that's the best way to solve our engine troubles.
Really? When did you become an expert on Maschinen, Kapitän?

Fields.MenuText: I am the captain of this ship, you know.
It doesn't take an expert to tell an amateur.
Gee, you're right, I'm sorry.

Fields.DialogueText: But we need our Maschinist!
I am no Amateur, Kapitän.
Your Sarkasmus isn't making this any easier, Kapitän.
That's it, we....
*ALARM*
Captain to the bridge, please, Captain to the bridge.
Great. Hipper, hold that thought.
@BATTLE
Kapitän, I-I believe I owe you an apology.
Anything specific you're thinking about, Hipper?
You know what I'm talking about.
Sometimes I do, sometimes I don't. This is one of the don'ts.
You don't remember our quarrel about the Maschinen? When I got so worked up? When you left, you seemed quite frustriert.
Honestly, I don't know what came over me.
That? Hipper, if that's the worst disagreement we have, we're doing fine. ... Though, now that you mention it, those engines are still an issue.
I know, I know.
Have you figured out what's wrong with them?
Nothing conclusive so far, which is why I keep pushing them.

Fields.MenuText: So, you're going to push them until something goes wrong?
So you're going to make something bad happen?
Are you sure our engine problems aren't perhaps... issues of your own creation?

Fields.DialogueText: Isn't that how we identify all Probleme in life?
Naa, I'm going to expose the bad before something bad happens.
D-don't be ridiculous, Kapitän. I would never do something to injure myself, or you, or the Mannschaft! I just have to keep at the Maschinen until I identify what is going on.
I'm not sure that's the smartest way to go about this, Hipper.
You should have heard some of the ideas the Mannschaft had for figuring out the issue. They gave new meaning to the words "not smart."
Hipper!
Wos? I love the Mannschaft, but it's true!
*ALARM*
All hands to battle stations, battle stations!
No testing the engines in battle, got that?
Naa! Of course not!
Good... wait, of course not to which? "No testing" or "got that?"
... Exactly!
Dammit, Hipper!
@BATTLE
You can't keep doing that, Hipper.
Doing what?
What you did earlier. Disappearing when conversations take a less than desirable turn.
Ah geh, when have I ever done that?
You've done it more than a few times already. It has to stop.
... I can't stop what isn't happening.
Hipper, we can't keep on like this! Constantly sniping at one another... it started during our initial talks about the engines-
There's something wrong with them, I swear!
- and it's moving into every crack and crevice of our discussions.
Nein. It isn't. Now, if you'll excuse me, I have to...

Fields.MenuText: No, I will not. Stay. That's an order.
No, I will not. Please stay, please.
No, I will not. We need to move past this.

Fields.DialogueText: I... of course, Kapitän.
I... for you, all right, Kapitän.
I... I think we already have.
*ALARM*
Captain, we've spotted smoke on the horizon.
Hipper, call for battle stations.
Ja, Kapitän.
We'll pick this up again in short order.
@BATTLE
Hipper, report!
Jawohl, Kapitän. Befehle, Kapitän?
Remain here. That's an order, just so we're clear.
Ja... yes, Kapitän.
We're going to start that talk now, though heaven knows we probably won't be able to finish it.
We have been a bit busy, haven't we? Why do you think we're seeing so much action?
We... no, that's not what we're talking about, don't try to distract me. We're going to talk about your...
Engines?
... problems.
My Maschinen are my Problem, Kapitän.

Fields.MenuText: That is far from your only problem.
I'm starting to think you have problems with communicating, too.
Your engines are merely the start.

Fields.DialogueText: ... I'm starting to think you're one of my biggest...
If you want me to communicate the truth, I can...
And my Kanonen will be the end of this conver...
Hipper!
I'm sorry, Kapitän. I... I don't know what's coming over me.
Whatever it is... we'll fix it, I promise.
You... you won't get rid of me?
Of course not, where would you get that idea?
*ALARM*
Enemy spotted, Captain!
Just trust me that we'll set things right. I won't let you down.
@BATTLE
Kapitän, I've been thinking about what you said.
I say a lot of things. Could you be more specific?
About not letting me down.
And I won't.
That's just the thing, Kapitän... I don't think you're the one in this Beziehung letting someone down.
Slow down, there... what relationship? What... oh, you mean, you think you're letting me down?
Ja. Obviously.

Fields.MenuText: That about sums it up, actually.
I know it isn't on purpose...
You're not letting me down, honestly.

Fields.DialogueText: I knew it!
But you still think I'm doing it!
Wohl! Why won't you just admit it?
That being said...
*ALARM*
Incoming transmission, Captain. HQ requests our presence at a possible Morgana sighting.
I'm going to help you, Hipper. Just have faith.
@BATTLE
Any word on my Maschinen, Kapitän?
None yet, but I'm waiting on the...
Are you sure you're not just trailing my Ankerkette?
Trailing your... what in the world does that mean?
It means you're telling me a Lüge.

Fields.MenuText: Hipper, do you not trust me?
No, Hipper, I most certainly am not trailing your chain.
Ah. No, I wouldn't waste my time with that.

Fields.DialogueText: Have you given me reason to trust you?
Du sogst des so, but how can I believe you?
You mean you wouldn't waste your time on me, stimmts?
Hipper, I really don't have time for another one of these conversations right now. I have paperwork piling up.
But Kapitän, my Maschinen really are...
I know, I know, but there's nothing I can do about them at the moment.
*ALARM*
Enemy sighted, port stern. Speed suggests Morgana flotilla.
The paperwork will have to wait. Are you ready to fight?
Ja. Of course.
@BATTLE
Hipper to the bridge, please.
Am I in trouble, Kapitän?
Trouble? No, it's time to start getting you that help I promised. Hipper, I'd like to introduce you to Doctor Hendrick. He specializes in the interaction between humans and Belles.
(Radio) Admiral Hipper, it's a pleasure to meet you.
On the Funke, Kapitän?
Hendrick is a busy man - he didn't have the time to come aboard for an extended period.
That bodes well...
But I've no doubt that he will be of assistance to you.
And what use would I have of a Doktor?
(Radio) Hipper, stand down.
Excuse me? Kapitän, are you going to let him speak to me like that?

Fields.MenuText: Got your attention, didn't it?
No, I'm not. Doctor Hendrick, please apologize to Hipper.
I'll let him say whatever he needs to say if it helps you.

Fields.DialogueText: So do bullets, but that doesn't mean I like them hurled at me.
Passt scho. Your sticking up for me is all I needed.
Then in that case, there are a few things I need to say to you!
(Radio) As touching as this is, I believe it isn't helping our cause. Admiral Hipper, it is my understanding that you need assistance in...
*ALARM*
Captain, Morgana mist forming off the stern!
Hipper, Doctor Hendrick, we'll have to return to this gripping conversation another time.
All hands battle stations, all hands battle stations!
@BATTLE
Time for your session with Doctor Hendrick, Hipper.
I don't like that Mann.
You don't even know him!
Imagine how much less I'll like him when I do know him.
Hipper....
(Radio) Don't worry, Kapitän, I get this kind of thing all the time.
You've worked with other Walküren?
(Radio) If I have, I couldn't tell you. Confidentiality and all that.
If you have? Does that mean you haven't?
(Radio) Kapitän?

Fields.MenuText: He's already answered the question, Hipper. Move on.
You think you're the only one with issues?
Have some faith, Hipper. I wouldn't have called if he couldn't help.

Fields.DialogueText: Not well enough, Kapitän.
Now that you mention it, you have a few we should discuss.
Faith is for those without power, Kapitän.
Discussion closed, Hipper.
Kapitän, I...
Captain, we've received a request for help from the fleet.
Answer in the affirmative and set course. Doctor Hendrick, we'll check in soon.
(Radio) I hope so, Kapitän. Nothing improves until it is worked upon.
After this engagement, we're going to have a discussion on attitude and acceptance, Hipper.
Ja, Kapitän.
@BATTLE
You wanted to see me, Kapitän?
I did. It's time for a session with Doctor Hendrick, and this time, no attitude. That's an order.
Jawohl, Kapitän.
(Radio) I'll cut right to the chase, Hipper. My understanding is that you're concerned about your engines but don't have any hard evidence there's an issue, correct?
I just know something's wrong, das ist alles.
And to be fair, there was evidence of some issues earlier on.
(Radio) I'm sorry, but I'm only talking to Miss Hipper, Kapitän.

Fields.MenuText: She's my responsibility, Doctor Hendrick.
Let's not forget who the captain is. I maintain this vessel and her crew.
I'm sorry, Hipper, but even my authority has limits.

Fields.DialogueText: You tell him, Kapitän!
Wait, are you calling me pflegebedürftig?
You could have tried a little harder...
(Radio) If you're going to remain a part of these sessions, I need you to follow my direction. Is that understood, Kapitän?
Unappreciated but understood.
(Radio) Good enough. Now, back to the matter at....
*ALARM*
Nixen fog forming off the starboard, Captain.
(Radio) I know my cue to leave.
@BATTLE
(Radio) So that's how you felt when your engines sputtered?
Ja, Doktor. That's the long and short of it.
(Radio) I see. Anything to add, Kapitän?

Fields.MenuText: Oh, now you want my opinion?
Now that you mention it, there are a few things to add.
I think Hipper covered everything adequately.

Fields.DialogueText: Just tell him what he wants to know, Kapitän.
Don't hold back, Kapitän!
No, I'm sure I missed something, sag schon!
(Radio) Interesting. Kapitän, Hipper here seems to value your opinion highly despite the somewhat limited time you've spent together.
Of course I do. The Kapitän is... well, my Kapitän.
(Radio) Well, yes, but you need to understand that not all of your fellows feel about their Kapitän the way you feel about yours.
And just how does she feel about me?
(Radio) That's not for me to...
W-wait, what happened to privacy?
(Radio) I was about to say that, Hipper. Kapitän, we can't...
*ALARM*
All hands, battle stations! Incoming Morgana mist!
Vorwärts, Kapitän, there's fighting to do!
@BATTLE
No Doctor Hendrick today, Hipper?
He said he had other business to attend to and would have to umdisponieren. He'll call me when ready.
And I'm sure if I inquired with him I'd be told the same?
Are you suggesting I'm dishonest, Kapitän?
Not in a thousand years... though possibly eliding, yes.
I don't think you have that Wort just right, Kapitän.
I think I have it just fine, Hipper.
Nein. Maybe something more like "evading?"

Fields.MenuText: I said what I meant, end of discussion.
Hmm... yes, that makes a bit more sense than mine.
Must we fight over everything?

Fields.DialogueText: Well, you don't have to be so rüde about it.
Thank you, that means a lot, Kapitän.
We only fight when we disagree!
And what does that mean?
Es... it means exactly what it means.
Captain, we're spotting something on the horizon that may or may not be Morgana mist forming.
Hipper, call all hands to battle stations just to be safe.
Natürlich.
Let's get to it.
@BATTLE
Ah, Hipper, did you finish your session with Doctor Hendrick?
Ja, Kapitän.
Any progress worth reporting?
It's like washing Gold, Kapitän. It takes a bit of sifting to find something worth keeping.
And even then it's probably just a flake of the real stuff, right?
Kapitän, you surprise me. I didn't know you were a Student of the history of Gold!

Fields.MenuText: I assure you, I think of little else in my spare time.
Knowing random facts does not an expert make, Hipper.
The things you don't know I know would boggle your mind... if only you knew.

Fields.DialogueText: Well, that can't be good for the Flotte and... wait a second...
But knowing random facts about an obscure Subjekt could...
I know that my head hurts now, though as to why....
*ALARM*
Confirmed sighting, Morgana mist ten degrees off the port bow!
As long as your engines are running smooth, I don't care what analogy you use. Keep sifting!
Perhaps we fight first, Kapitän?
Yes, yes.
@BATTLE
What's that you're working on there, Hipper?
Hausaufgaben.
And who could possibly give you homework on my... wait, is this an assignment from Doctor Hendrick?
None other. And you'll never believe it, but I think I'm somewhat enjoying it.
What does he have you...
Don't look, Kapitän!

Fields.MenuText: Well, excuse the hell out of me!
Of course. I'm sorry - I didn't mean to invade your privacy.
You... want to rephrase that?

Fields.DialogueText: Hey, you startled me, remember?
Just be more careful next time, okay?
Natürlich. How about, "Please don't look, Kapitän?"
Mmmm. Still, that doesn't excuse you snapping at your captain.
I think we've both faulted here, Kapitän. You by poking your Nase in my business, me in snapping at my Kapitän.
To be fair, it was YOU walking around with your homework for everyone to see.
Distress call, Captain. We're the closest response vessel.
Let's set a course and move ahead, best possible speed.
Ja, Kapitän.
And a final thought, Hipper. If you don't want people to see what you're doing, maybe a more private setting is the way to go.
Ja, Kapitän.
@BATTLE
Hipper, I... did I miss Doctor Hendrick today?
Ja, we just finished. He had a number of insights heute.
Drat! I was hoping to catch the both of you together so I wouldn't have to say this twice.
Say what twice?
I wanted to let you both know that whatever you're doing, it's working.
You think so?
I know so. I was reviewing the fuel logs with the 1WO, and there's been a marked improvement in performance since you started your sessions.
Well, I guess we'll have to take that as good news.
You guess? Hipper, what's wrong? I thought you'd be excited to hear that.
Oh, zweifellos, Kapitän, I'm as happy as I can be.
That sounds morose. Are you sure you're all right?
Well enough. It's just... the things Doktor Hendrick has me thinking about are somewhat exhausting.

Fields.MenuText: Should I have him pull back a bit and give you some space?
But they're working, so we're not changing a thing!
I see. Have you considered taking a few hours off for yourself?

Fields.DialogueText: Nein, nein, but thank you very much. This needs to happen, I think.
*seufz* Agreed, Kapitän.
Every time I speak with Hendrick, absolutely.
*ALARM*
Battle stations, battle stations!
Think about it, Hipper. I meant what I said.
Ja, Kapitän.
@BATTLE
Greetings, Hipper. You look a bit more... perky... than the last time I saw you.
I feel a bit besser, I have to admit.
Those sessions with Doctor Hendrick continuing to work out well, then?
I guess it's like popping a wound. It has to hurt before it can feel better. But he has been very helpful.
So does that mean you're finished with him, then?
Not remotely.

Fields.MenuText: Understood.
I can't help wonder who is helping whom in that relationship.
Why can't I shake the feeling that something... nefarious... is going on?

Fields.DialogueText: Well... good. Danke.
You worry too much, Kapitän. He's helping me, believe it.
Kapitän, please!
You know, you spend too much time with him, you're liable to make me a little jealous.
Jealous? Well, I...
*ALARM*
All hands, battle stations, battle stations!
Let's just get to it, shall we?
@BATTLE
All right, Hipper, I'm here. What's so important?
Kapitän, Doctor Hendrick is on the receiver with us.
(Radio) Kapitän, thank you for joining us.
I wasn't aware there would be an "us," Doctor Hendrick.
(Radio) Does that bother you?
Should it?
I don't know. Hipper told me you were getting jealous of our time together, so I wonder if this is an issue.

Fields.MenuText: You told him what?
It was a joke!
Oh, for the love of... I'm sorry, Doctor. This is a misunderstanding.

Fields.DialogueText: It's part of the Therapie, Kapitän. Trust me.
My apologies, Kapitän. I misunderstood.
It is?
(Radio) Rest assured, Kapitän, I already know what I need to know. I only wanted to learn your reaction.
Someone better start explaining what's going on...
Captain, we're picking up a strange distress call. It sounds... well... fake.
Likely of Morgana origin. Hipper, we ought to set course and prepare for battle.
Aye, Kapitän.
(Radio) I'll get back with you shortly, Kapitän. Hipper, until next time.
Kapitän, I...
Later, Hipper. Let's get to work.
@BATTLE
I assume we need to speak to Hendrick again?
Not today, Kapitän. Today, it's just us.
It's been a while since that was so.
Just like the good old days, gell?

Fields.MenuText: My thoughts exactly, just you and me against the world.
Old? They weren't that long ago.
Actually, I think the old days were a little more tense. But, sure.

Fields.DialogueText: I thought you might say that.
Still, it feels as if we've known one another for some time, doesn't it?
Not quite a resounding vote of confidence, but fair enough.
Anyway, what's this about?
Have you noticed anything different about the Schiff, Kapitän?
Mmm... no... can't say that I have. Everything's running smoothly.
Smoothly?
Indeed. In fact, we've never run this... wait, does this mean...
*ALARM*
All hands, battle stations, battle stations!
Vorwärts, Kapitän, let's get moving!
Wait, what about... arrgh, all right, let's go!
@BATTLE
Have Zeit to talk, Kapitän?
Absolutely. Tell me, is it my imagination, or are your engines running smoother than ever before?
If you've noticed it, it isn't your imagination.
What changed?
I'd rather have Doktor Hendrick here to help explain it, if you don't mind.
All right, then - let's get him on the horn.
I'm afraid he's not available just now, Kapitän.
And when will he be, then?
How should I know?

Fields.MenuText: Well, you're the one who's talking to him five times a week.
I'm sorry, I just assumed....
It just makes sense, you know?

Fields.DialogueText: You're the one who told me to work with him!
Well, you assumed wrong... Kapitän.
Maybe to you, it does.
I... all right, all right, just... let's just move on.
Sei's drum, you're right that my Maschinen are running better. In fact, they're betsser than ever!
*ALARM*
Battle stations, battle stations, all hands battle stations!
You heard him, let's get moving!
Let's go.
@BATTLE
I still can't believe how well you're running, Hipper.
How well I'm running? Is that all I am to you, Kapitän, a Maschine?
Hipper, I... that's not how I meant it.
But that's how it came out.
But that's not how it was meant.
Still, I think...

Fields.MenuText: Hipper, seriously, we need to stop this pointless fighting.
I'm sorry it came out that way, Hipper.
You can't have it all, Hipper, you just can't.

Fields.DialogueText: It's only pointless if you don't understand.
No harm done, Kapitän... you were only speaking your piece.
I don't want it all, I just want your Respekt!
Now that sounds like something from therapy.
Therapie? We were just two friends talking.
What does that have to do with...
*ALARM*
Captain, we're seeing Morgana mist form off the port...
All hands, battle stations! Hipper, we'll get back to this soon enough.
But, Kapitän, we...
No, let's go to battle.
@BATTLE
Is he here?
On the receiver, Kapitän.
(Radio) Kapitän.
Doctor Hendrick.
Doktor.
Hipper.
Hipper!
Kapitän?
Enough of this, please. For the love of God.
(Radio) I thought we were here to discuss the end of Hipper's therapy.

Fields.MenuText: It seemed like we were starting a burlesque sketch.
Sorry. By all means, let's get to the point.
We can discuss anything you like as long as that means we move beyond the introduction portion of this conversation.

Fields.DialogueText: Kapitän!
The point is the end, Kapitän.
There's no need to be in such a hurry, Kapitän.
Don't "Kapitän" me, Hipper.
*ALARM*
Captain to the bridge.
Wonderful. Excuse me.
@BATTLE
All right, Hipper, let's buckle down and get to the bottom of this situation.
(Radio) That's the spirit, Kapitän.
The fewer interruptions, the better. I mean, you know the Morganas are going to....
Wait until you hear what he has to say, Kapitän. Bitte.
Sorry. Carry on.
(Radio) I must admit, Kapitän, that this has been a most intriguing case. I've never dealt with a Belle before. At least, not knowingly.
I was told you were an expert!
(Radio) I can't speak to that. All I ever said was that I had some experience, which I have... though I'm not telling you how.
Anyway....
(Radio) Anyway, it didn't take long to pinpoint the root of Hipper's problems. After that, it was a simple matter of getting her to recognize the issue, confront it, and move past it.
And what was the issue?
(Radio) I'm afraid I can't tell you without Hipper's permission. It's her right, after all.

Fields.MenuText: Fine, fine... Hipper, please tell Hendrick to let me in on the secret.
So, essentially, I've been called here so that you can tell me things have been resolved without telling me how. You could've written a letter, Doctor.
Hipper, would it be all right if Doctor Hendrick explained the issue to me?

Fields.DialogueText: By your preference, Kapitän.
It's all right, Doktor.
Absolut, and thank you for asking.
(Radio) Now that that's out of the way, I...
*ALARM*
All hands, incoming Morgana mist, prepare to engage.
Every... single... time!
(Radio) I promise, you'll have answers the next time we speak. Until then, go foul up some enemies for me.
Now that I can do. Hipper, let's get a move on!
Aye, Kapitän!
@BATTLE
... Uh-huh.
All right, Doctor Hendrick, let's have those answers you promised.
(Radio) Of course. Hipper's main issue was... well... you, Kapitän.
Me?
(Radio) You.
Hipper, is this true?
Ja, Kapitän, though it's not what you probably think it is.
Okay. Okay, how can I fix this? What did I do to make you so... so...
Ja?

Fields.MenuText: Angry?
Nervous?
Problematic?

Fields.DialogueText: Angry? No, I was never angry with you, Kapitän... at least, that's not what caused my Probleme.
Nervös? Hmm, I guess that was part of it.
Problematisch? That was the issue, but not the cause.
Then what was?
*ALARM*
All hands, general quarters!
Doctor Hendrick, thank you for your time, but I believe you are done here, yes?
(Radio) Absolutely. Hipper, best of luck in your final step.
Danke, Doktor. Be well.
Wait, final step? What final step?
Später, Kapitän. For now, it's off to battle!
@BATTLE
All right, Hipper, time to come clean.
As you wish. The Kurzversion is that... well... hmm....
I hate to rush you, but there's been a lot of enemy activity around here, and....
Ja. I'm just... I'm not the best at kommunizieren. I can get by, but when I'm under Druck, my ability tends to go into a Sturzflug.
From the start, all I wanted was your Respekt. But the issues with the Maschinen unnerved me.
As a Resultat, I became defensiv. I also read too much into the things you said, looking for any sign of you being dissatisfied with me.
I know that's something I need to work on.
Kapitän?
I... I think I probably have things I need to work on as well. I'm supposed to be your captain, and instead of attempting to remedy our communication problems from the start, well...
I think I only fed into them.
But you didn't give up on me. You introduced me to Doktor Hendrick. And because of my Sitzungen with him, I think we might have a chance at decent Kommunikation, after all.
What do you say, Kapitän?

Fields.MenuText: Well, I have some misgivings about Doctor Hendrick... but I think it would be in both of our best interests to learn to better understand one another.
Hipper... yes, of course. We're supposed to be a team. I think we could be a great one, if we work at it.

Fields.DialogueText: Don't worry, I'll teach you everything you need to know. We'll leave Doctor Hendrick out of it.
I'm so happy to hear you say that, Kapitän.
